title: Creating a Diagram
text: First, use a diagram such as the attached one to record the given information. It is also helpful to introduce a temporary variable, W, to represent the width of the garden and the length of the fence section parallel to the backyard fence.\n##figure1.gif##
speech: First, use a diagram such as the attached one to record the given information. It is also helpful to introduce a temporary variable, W, to represent the width of the garden and the length of the fence section parallel to the backyard fence.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Relating Two Variables Through an Equation
text: We know we have only $$80$$ feet of fence available, and $$L+W+L=80$$, or more simply, $$2L+W=80$$. This allows us to represent the width, W, in terms of L with the equation $$W=80-2L$$.

title: Writing an Equation for Area
text: We know the area of a rectangle is length multiplied by width, so $$A=LW=L(80-2L)=80L-2L^2$$.

title: General Form of the Equation
